page.title: 04INSIDE THE LOWER SCHOOL
page.content: Southill Lower School is very small with 47 children but there is only a slight possibility of it closing down.The headmistress and the children didn't want to see the school enlarged or changed in any way, but they would like more children and teachers.At the school there is an outdoor swimming pool,which is only used when the weather is nice.The teachers can go in but that was a matter of preference.The children start lessons at 9.00 a.m,have a break at 10.25 a.m and have lessons up to a lunchtime break at 12.25 p.m.25 children eat sandwiches, the rest eat school meals. Then they have more lessons until an afternoon break and go home at 3.30 by bus.The children come from the villages of Broom,Chicksands,Ireland Southill and Stanford.
